TEXT.P: Age structure is the key to knowing how a population will change in the future. Age structure refers to how many individuals are infants, how many are young adults, how many elderly, and so on.
The table at left shows the age structure for Madagascar in 2000. Each row represents a different age group: newborn to 4 years old, 5 to 9 years old, and so on.
How many females age 20 to 24 are in this population? How many males age 65 to 69?
